name: Avoid large Files - too many Lines of Code (Kotlin)
description: This rule searches for kotlin(.kt) files that contain more than X lines of code. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
output:
This report lists all kotlin files with more than X lines of code. 
It provides the following information: 
 - File name
 - Number of lines
rationale: Large files are more difficult to read and manage and this can decrease the application maintenance.
remediation: Divide the code up to many files
alternativeName: Ensure to have kotlin files with smaller amount of code to ensure maintainability in the long run

technicalCriteria.name: CWE-1080: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
